news.summary: The US economy added 119,000 jobs in September, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics. Wall Street economists expected a gain of around 50,000 positions. The unemployment rate crept up to 4.4% in September.
news.article_text:
The US economy added 119,000 positions in September, data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics showed Thursday, an unexpected boost to the labor market that has lately shown signs of a possible slowdown.

news.article_text: Last week, you might have seen that Thomson Reuters Corporation (TSE:TRI) released its quarterly result to the market. The early response was not positive, with shares down 9.2% to CA$196 in the past week. It looks like a credible result overall - although revenues of US$1.8b were what the analysts expected, Thomson Reuters surprised by delivering a (statutory) profit of US$0.94 per share, an impressive 33% above what was forecast. news.article_text: Thomson Reuters (TSX:TRI) is projecting earnings growth of 8.6% per year, trailing the Canadian market's expected 12.1% pace. Annual revenue growth is set for 7.5%, comfortably above the broader market’s 5.1% expectation. Current net profit margins are 23.8%, down from 31.2% last year. news.article_text:
This article first appeared on GuruFocus.

PDD Holdings (NASDAQ:PDD), owner of Temu, slid nearly 1.5% on Wednesday after its third-quarter results beat EPS estimates but fell short on revenue.

For the three months ended Sept., adjusted EPS rose to $2.97 from $2.62 a year earlier, topping the $2.33 analysts expected. Revenue reached $15.23 billion, up 7% from $14.27 billion a year earlier but below Wall Street's $15.38 billion forecast.
